title: About Alex Napierski
text:
Background

I‚Äôm a Strategic Management student at BYU‚Äôs Marriott School of Business with a passion for healthcare innovation and digital solutions. My unique combination of business strategy, healthcare leadership, and technical skills allows me to bridge the gap between strategic vision and practical implementation.
Currently maintaining a 3.97 GPA while leading multiple initiatives across healthcare, product development, and student organizations. I believe in leveraging data-driven insights and strategic thinking to create meaningful impact in healthcare and technology sectors.

title: Healthy Student Planner
text:
This project involved using Claude Code to develop a comprehensive student planner application focused on promoting healthy habits and effective time management. The application combines academic planning with wellness tracking to help students maintain both academic success and personal well-being.
The primary purpose of this app is to:

Help students organize their academic schedules and assignments effectively
Promote healthy lifestyle habits through integrated wellness tracking
Provide a user-friendly interface for comprehensive student life management
Demonstrate full-stack web development skills and user-centered design

title: Healthy Student Planner
text:
Live Product Demo

title: Healthy Student Planner
text:
Technical Details
Framework/Stack: HTML, CSS3, JavaScript
Deployment: Vercel (Live Production)
Tools Used: - Claude Code for development assistance and feature planning - HTML/CSS for responsive layout and styling - JavaScript for interactive functionality and data management - Local Storage for data persistence - Git/GitHub for version control

title: Healthy Student Planner
text:
Key Features

Academic Planning: Course scheduling, assignment tracking, and deadline management
Health & Wellness Integration: Habit tracking, wellness goals, and lifestyle monitoring
Intuitive Interface: Clean, user-friendly design optimized for student workflows
Data Persistence: Local storage ensures user data is maintained between sessions
Responsive Design: Works seamlessly across desktop and mobile devices

title: Healthy Student Planner
text:
Development Approach
This project was built using a collaborative approach with Claude Code, focusing on:

User-Centered Design: Understanding student needs for both academic and health management
Feature Integration: Seamlessly combining planning tools with wellness tracking
Usability Testing: Iterative design improvements based on user experience principles
Code Quality: Clean, maintainable architecture with modular functionality

The development process emphasized creating a practical tool that addresses real student challenges while demonstrating modern web development capabilities and thoughtful user experience design.

title: Market Entry Strategy Analysis
text: Summarize the market entry challenge and your role in developing the strategy. What new market or product category were you analyzing?

title: Market Entry Strategy Analysis
text: Summarize the market entry challenge and your role in developing the strategy. What new market or product category were you analyzing?

title: Market Entry Strategy Analysis
text:
Executive Summary
Provide a high-level overview of your recommendations and the expected impact. This section should be accessible to both technical and business stakeholders.

title: Market Entry Strategy Analysis
text:
Market Analysis

Industry Landscape

What is the size and growth rate of the target market?
Who are the major players and what market share do they hold?
What are the key industry trends and drivers?



Competitive Analysis

Who are your direct and indirect competitors?
What are their strengths, weaknesses, and market positioning?
Where are the gaps and opportunities?



Customer Analysis

Who is your target customer?
What are their needs, pain points, and preferences?
How do they currently solve the problem you‚Äôre addressing?

title: Market Entry Strategy Analysis
text:
Strategic Framework

Market Opportunity

What specific opportunity did you identify?
How large is the addressable market?
What factors make this the right time to enter?



Value Proposition

What unique value does your product/service offer?
How does it differentiate from existing solutions?
Why would customers choose you over alternatives?



Go-to-Market Strategy

What channels will you use to reach customers?
How will you price your offering?
What partnerships or alliances are needed?

title: Market Entry Strategy Analysis
text:
Research Methodology

Data Sources

What primary research did you conduct?
Which secondary sources did you leverage?
How did you ensure data quality and reliability?



Analysis Techniques

What frameworks did you apply (Porter‚Äôs Five Forces, SWOT, etc.)?
Which quantitative and qualitative methods did you use?
How did you validate your assumptions?

title: Market Entry Strategy Analysis
text:
Key Findings

Market Insights
Present your 3-5 most important discoveries:

Insight #1: Description and implications
Insight #2: Description and implications

Insight #3: Description and implications



Customer Insights

What did you learn about customer behavior and preferences?
What unmet needs did you identify?
How price-sensitive is the target market?

title: Market Entry Strategy Analysis
text:
Strategic Recommendations

Market Entry Approach

What entry strategy do you recommend (direct, partnership, acquisition)?
What should be the geographic focus?
What‚Äôs the optimal timing for launch?



Product Strategy

What features should be prioritized for launch?
How should the product be positioned?
What pricing strategy will maximize adoption?



Resource Requirements

What investment is needed?
What capabilities must be developed?
What partnerships are critical for success?

title: Market Entry Strategy Analysis
text:
Implementation Roadmap

Phase 1: Foundation (Months 1-3)

Key activities and milestones
Resource requirements
Success metrics



Phase 2: Launch (Months 4-9)

Go-to-market execution
Customer acquisition strategy
Performance monitoring



Phase 3: Scale (Months 10-18)

Expansion opportunities
Optimization initiatives
Long-term growth strategy

title: Market Entry Strategy Analysis
text:
Risk Assessment

Key Risks

What are the primary threats to success?
How likely are these risks to materialize?
What would be the potential impact?



Mitigation Strategies

How can each risk be reduced or eliminated?
What contingency plans should be developed?
What early warning indicators should be monitored?

title: Market Entry Strategy Analysis
text:
Expected Outcomes

Financial Projections

What revenue potential do you forecast?
What are the key cost drivers?
When do you expect to reach profitability?



Success Metrics

How will you measure progress and success?
What leading and lagging indicators will you track?
What are the key performance benchmarks?

title: Market Entry Strategy Analysis
text:
Conclusion
Summarize your recommendations and their strategic importance. Emphasize the opportunity size, competitive advantages, and expected returns on investment.

Skills Demonstrated: Market Research, Strategic Analysis, Business Planning, Financial Modeling, Competitive Intelligence, Stakeholder Communication
Tools Used: Excel, Tableau, Survey Tools, Industry Databases, Financial Modeling Software

title: Business Case Presentation
text: This project focused on developing a comprehensive business case and pitch presentation for a new product opportunity. The assignment required identifying a market need, analyzing the opportunity, and presenting a compelling case for why the product should be built and funded.

title: Business Case Presentation
text: This project focused on developing a comprehensive business case and pitch presentation for a new product opportunity. The assignment required identifying a market need, analyzing the opportunity, and presenting a compelling case for why the product should be built and funded.

title: Business Case Presentation
text:
Executive Summary
Product Concept: [Brief description of your proposed product/service]
Market Opportunity: [Size and growth potential of target market]
Investment Required: [Estimated funding needed]
Expected Return: [Projected revenue and profitability timeline]
Recommendation: [Clear go/no-go recommendation with supporting rationale]

title: Business Case Presentation
text:
Problem Statement

Market Problem

Issue Identification: What specific problem does your product solve?
Target Audience: Who experiences this problem most acutely?
Current Solutions: How are people solving this problem today?
Gap Analysis: What‚Äôs missing from existing solutions?



Quantifying the Problem

Market Size: How many people/organizations face this issue?
Economic Impact: What does this problem cost users currently?
Urgency: Why is now the right time to solve this problem?
Evidence: What data supports the existence and scale of this problem?

title: Business Case Presentation
text:
Market Analysis

Industry Overview

Market Size: Total Addressable Market (TAM), Serviceable Addressable Market (SAM)
Growth Trends: Historical growth rates and future projections
Key Drivers: What factors are driving market growth?
Market Maturity: Where is this market in its lifecycle?



Competitive Landscape

Direct Competitors: Who offers similar solutions?
Indirect Competitors: What alternative approaches exist?
Competitive Advantages: How will you differentiate?
Market Positioning: Where will you fit in the competitive landscape?



Customer Analysis

Target Segments: Primary and secondary customer groups
User Personas: Detailed profiles of ideal customers
Buying Behavior: How do customers make purchase decisions?
Price Sensitivity: What are customers willing to pay?

title: Business Case Presentation
text:
Solution Overview

Product Vision

Core Value Proposition: What unique value do you provide?
Key Features: What are the essential product capabilities?
User Experience: How will customers interact with your product?
Differentiation: What makes your solution superior?



Product Strategy

Development Approach: Build vs.¬†buy vs.¬†partner decisions
Technology Stack: What technical foundation will you use?
Scalability: How will the product grow with demand?
Innovation: What makes this solution innovative?

title: Business Case Presentation
text:
Business Model

Revenue Model

Pricing Strategy: How will you price your product?
Revenue Streams: What are your sources of income?
Customer Acquisition: How will you attract customers?
Unit Economics: What are your cost and revenue per customer?



Financial Projections

Revenue Forecast: 3-5 year revenue projections
Cost Structure: Development, operational, and marketing costs
Profitability Timeline: When will you reach break-even?
Investment Requirements: Funding needed for different milestones



Go-to-Market Strategy

Launch Strategy: How will you introduce the product?
Marketing Channels: How will you reach customers?
Sales Strategy: Direct, partner, or hybrid approach?
Customer Success: How will you ensure customer satisfaction?

title: Business Case Presentation
text:
Implementation Plan

Development Roadmap

Phase 1: MVP development and initial testing
Phase 2: Full product launch and market entry

Phase 3: Scale and expansion opportunities
Milestones: Key deliverables and timeline



Resource Requirements

Team Structure: What roles and skills are needed?
Technology Infrastructure: What systems and tools are required?
Capital Requirements: Funding needs by phase
Strategic Partnerships: What alliances will accelerate success?



Risk Analysis

Market Risks: What could change in the market?
Technical Risks: What development challenges might arise?
Competitive Risks: How might competitors respond?
Mitigation Strategies: How will you address each risk?

title: Business Case Presentation
text:
Success Metrics

Key Performance Indicators

Customer Metrics: Acquisition, retention, satisfaction
Business Metrics: Revenue, profitability, market share
Product Metrics: Usage, engagement, feature adoption
Operational Metrics: Efficiency, quality, scalability



Success Criteria

Short-term (6 months): [Specific measurable goals]
Medium-term (1-2 years): [Growth and market position targets]
Long-term (3-5 years): [Vision achievement and expansion goals]

title: Business Case Presentation
text:
Investment Recommendation

Case for Investment

Market Opportunity: Large, growing market with clear need
Competitive Advantage: Defensible differentiation and positioning
Team Capability: Right skills and experience to execute
Financial Returns: Attractive risk-adjusted return potential
Strategic Fit: Aligns with organizational goals and capabilities



Expected Outcomes

Revenue Impact: [Projected revenue contribution]
Market Position: [Expected market share and positioning]
Strategic Value: [Broader organizational benefits]
Growth Platform: [Future expansion opportunities]

title: Business Case Presentation
text:
Next Steps

Immediate Actions (30 days)

Secure initial funding/approval
Finalize team structure and hiring
Complete technical feasibility analysis
Develop detailed project plan



Short-term Milestones (90 days)

Complete market validation research
Build MVP and conduct user testing
Establish key partnerships
Refine go-to-market strategy



Long-term Goals (1 year)

Launch product to target market
Achieve customer acquisition targets
Demonstrate product-market fit
Plan expansion opportunities

title: Business Case Presentation
text:
Appendices

Supporting Data

Market research reports and analysis
Customer interview findings
Competitive analysis details
Financial model assumptions



Presentation Materials

Slide Deck: [Link to presentation slides]
Executive Summary: [One-page business case summary]

Financial Model: [Detailed financial projections]
Supporting Research: [Market data and analysis]


Skills Demonstrated: Business Strategy, Market Analysis, Financial Modeling, Presentation Design, Strategic Planning
Tools Used: PowerPoint/Keynote, Excel/Google Sheets, Market Research Databases, Survey Tools

title: Resume
text:
What‚Äôs Next



 Career Aspirations

 Healthcare Technology: Improving patient experiences through digital solutions

I‚Äôm excited to contribute to organizations that value strategic thinking, innovation, and making a positive difference in people‚Äôs lives.

title: Resume
text:
About Me



 Background


I‚Äôm a Strategic Management student at BYU‚Äôs Marriott School of Business with a passion for healthcare innovation and digital solutions. My unique combination of business strategy, healthcare leadership, and technical skills allows me to bridge the gap between strategic vision and practical implementation.
Currently maintaining a 3.97 GPA while leading multiple initiatives across healthcare, product development, and student organizations. I believe in leveraging data-driven insights and strategic thinking to create meaningful impact in healthcare and technology sectors.

title: About Me
text:
Strategic Thinker | Global Explorer | Adventure Enthusiast


‚ÄúTo live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.‚Äù - Oscar Wilde

title: About Me
text:
The Adventure Side of Me üåç



 Always Chasing the Next Adventure


I‚Äôm not your typical business student! When I‚Äôm not diving deep into strategic management or healthcare innovation, you‚Äôll find me seeking adrenaline rushes and exploring the world. I believe that the best leaders are those who aren‚Äôt afraid to step outside their comfort zone‚Äîliterally.
This past summer, I had the incredible opportunity to travel to 9 different countries studying various health systems and populations. But of course, I couldn‚Äôt just stick to the academic side‚ÄîI made sure to pack in some epic adventures along the way!

title: About Me
text:
Epic Adventures üèîÔ∏è





 Paragliding in Switzerland

Nothing beats the rush of jumping off a mountain in the Swiss Alps! This was definitely one of those ‚Äúpinch me‚Äù moments where I couldn‚Äôt believe this was part of my ‚Äústudy abroad‚Äù experience.






 Conquering Norwegian Cliffs

Standing on the edge of this Norwegian cliff reminded me that sometimes the best views come after the scariest climbs. Kind of like my approach to business challenges!








üá≥üá¥ Norway Explorer

The fjords were absolutely incredible‚Äîdefinitely adding ‚Äúmove to Norway‚Äù to my post-graduation plans (just kidding‚Ä¶ maybe).






üáÆüáπ Italian Escapades

Italy stole my heart (and probably added 10 pounds with all that gelato). The perfect mix of culture, history, and incredible food!






üéæ French Open Dreams

Made it to the French Open this summer! As a huge tennis fan, this was basically my Super Bowl. The energy at Roland Garros was unreal.

title: About Me
section: Fun Facts That Might Surprise You üéØ
text:
Fun Facts That Might Surprise You üéØ



 Random & Cool Stuff About Me




üè∏ Twin Power! I‚Äôm a twin! My twin brother and I are basically two parts of the same adventurous spirit. We keep each other grounded‚Ä¶ or encourage each other‚Äôs crazy ideas, depending on the day.
üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Big Family Energy I‚Äôm the 3rd of 12 children! Yes, you read that right‚Äîtwelve! Family dinners are basically small conferences, and I learned early how to speak up and lead in chaotic situations (great training for business, honestly).
üéæ Tennis Obsessed I‚Äôm totally obsessed with tennis! I earned the Tennis Academic All-State Award and was Freshman Basketball Team Captain. Sports taught me everything about competition, teamwork, and never giving up.


ü¶Ö Eagle Scout Achievement I‚Äôm the first-ever Napierski to earn the Eagle Scout Award! It took dedication, leadership, and a lot of camping (which prepared me well for sleeping in hostels across Europe).
üåç Health Systems Explorer This summer I studied health systems across 9 countries in Europe. It was incredible to see how different cultures approach healthcare‚Äîfrom Switzerland‚Äôs precision to Italy‚Äôs warm patient care.
üè• Service Heart I‚Äôm currently providing wheelchairs for underprivileged children in Ecuador, and I‚Äôve led service projects for children in Honduras. Nothing beats the feeling of making a real difference in someone‚Äôs life.

title: About Me
text:
The Family That Adventures Together üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶


With 11 siblings, life is never boring! We‚Äôre a tight-knit crew that values adventure, service, and supporting each other‚Äôs crazy dreams. They‚Äôre my biggest cheerleaders and the reason I‚Äôm always pushing myself to do something exciting and important.
Family taught me that leadership isn‚Äôt about being the loudest person in the room‚Äîit‚Äôs about bringing people together and making sure everyone feels heard (especially when you‚Äôre competing with 11 other voices at the dinner table!).

title: About Me
text:
What Drives Me üöÄ



 My Philosophy


I believe that the best business leaders are those who have lived a little, taken risks, and aren‚Äôt afraid to step outside their comfort zone. Whether I‚Äôm paragliding off a Swiss mountain or diving into a complex healthcare case study, I bring the same energy: curiosity, courage, and a willingness to learn.
My adventures around the world have taught me that innovation happens when you combine different perspectives, take calculated risks, and never stop exploring what‚Äôs possible. That‚Äôs exactly the mindset I bring to everything I do‚Äîfrom healthcare innovation to strategic management.
Bottom line: I‚Äôm building a career in healthcare and business, but I‚Äôm also building a life full of stories worth telling. And trust me, this is just the beginning! üåü


  Let‚Äôs Connect!    LinkedIn    GitHub

title: About Me
text:
Beyond the Classroom üåç



 A Different Perspective on Leadership


While I‚Äôm passionate about strategic management and healthcare innovation, I‚Äôve always believed that some of the best learning happens outside the classroom. I love seeking out new challenges and experiences that push me to grow, whether that‚Äôs academically, personally, or just for the pure adventure of it.
This past summer, I was incredibly fortunate to travel to 9 different countries studying various health systems and populations. What started as an academic opportunity turned into one of the most eye-opening experiences of my life. I learned so much about different approaches to healthcare, but honestly, the cultural experiences and adventures along the way taught me just as much about myself.

title: About Me
text:
International Experiences üèîÔ∏è





 Switzerland: Taking the Leap

I‚Äôll be honest‚Äîjumping off a mountain in Switzerland was terrifying! But there‚Äôs something about pushing through that fear and trusting the process that was incredibly rewarding. Plus, the views were absolutely unreal.






 Norway: Finding My Edge

Standing on this cliff in Norway was one of those moments where you feel incredibly small but also incredibly alive. Sometimes the best views really do come after the hardest climbs.








üá≥üá¥ Norway: Simply Breathtaking

The fjords in Norway were unlike anything I‚Äôd ever seen. I spent hours just sitting and taking it all in‚Äîdefinitely one of those travel moments that stays with you forever.






üáÆüáπ Italy: La Dolce Vita

Italy completely won me over. Between the incredible food, amazing people, and rich history, I could have stayed for months. I definitely practiced my Italian more than I studied healthcare systems some days!






üéæ France: Living the Dream

Getting to the French Open was honestly a dream come true for this tennis fanatic. The atmosphere at Roland Garros was electric‚ÄîI was like a kid in a candy store the entire time.

title: About Me
text:
Personal Background & Achievements üéØ



 Personal & Professional Development




Twin Life Being a twin has been such a unique experience! My twin brother and I have always pushed each other to be better, whether that‚Äôs in academics, sports, or just life in general. We‚Äôre pretty competitive, but in the best way possible.
Big Family Energy Growing up as the 3rd of 12 children definitely keeps you on your toes! Family dinners are basically organized chaos, and you learn pretty quickly how to speak up and how to listen. It‚Äôs taught me so much about working with different personalities and finding ways to bring people together.
Tennis and Basketball I‚Äôve been playing tennis since I was young and absolutely love it. Getting the Tennis Academic All-State Award was such an honor, and being Basketball Team Captain as a freshman taught me a lot about earning respect through hard work rather than just talking.


Eagle Scout Achievement I‚Äôm really proud to be the first in my family to earn Eagle Scout. It took a lot of dedication and taught me so much about following through on commitments and working with others toward a common goal.
Health Systems Study Studying health systems across 9 European countries was fascinating. It was incredible to see how different cultures approach healthcare‚Äîsome focused on efficiency, others on relationship-building with patients. Each country taught me something new.
Service Projects One of the things I‚Äôm most passionate about is service work. I‚Äôm currently working on getting wheelchairs to kids in Ecuador, and I‚Äôve done projects in Honduras too. There‚Äôs something really fulfilling about being able to help in a practical, tangible way.

title: About Me
text:
Family Foundation üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶


With 11 siblings, life is never quiet! But honestly, I wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. We‚Äôre all really close and incredibly supportive of each other. Our family has always emphasized hard work, serving others, and chasing after meaningful goals‚Äîeven if they seem a little crazy sometimes.
Growing up in such a big family has taught me that everyone has something valuable to contribute, and the best decisions usually come when you take time to really listen to different perspectives.

title: About Me
text:
Professional Philosophy üöÄ



 Leadership Approach


I‚Äôm still figuring out exactly where my career will take me, but I know I want to work on things that matter‚Äîespecially in healthcare where I can help make a real difference in people‚Äôs lives. I‚Äôve learned that some of my best insights come from unexpected places, whether that‚Äôs from a conversation with a patient in a European hospital or from pushing through a challenging hike in Norway.
I think curiosity and humility are probably my biggest assets. I genuinely love learning from other people, and I‚Äôve found that staying curious and being willing to admit when you don‚Äôt know something usually leads to the most interesting discoveries.
My goal is to build a career where I can combine my love for problem-solving with my desire to serve others, and hopefully have some great adventures along the way.


  Let‚Äôs Connect!    LinkedIn    GitHub
